definition: thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress

sentences.english: This is the sagacity that how your person highly praises and clement.
sentences.chinese: 这是多么令人赞叹的聪敏与宽厚。

sentences.english: He perceives his delicate constitution , and the necessity of treating him tolerably.
sentences.chinese: 他看到他娇弱的体质，有必要对他宽厚些。

sentences.english: Poor dear old Bishop Grantly had on this matter been too lenient.
sentences.chinese: 已故的亲爱的老格伦雷主教在这个问题上过分宽厚。

sentences.english: He who in adversity would have succor, let him be generous while he rests secure. (Saki, British writer)
sentences.chinese: 谁想在逆境中得到援助，就应在身处顺境时待人宽厚。

sentences.english: During seasons when water and nutrients are in good supply, trees form broad growth rings.
sentences.chinese: 当水源和营养元素充足时，树木的年轮显得比较宽厚。

sentences.english: The technology and flow sheet of No. 2 walking beam furnace of AISC Heavy plate Plant are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍鞍钢宽厚板厂2号步进式加热炉的工艺及流程。

sentences.english: Lu Mu Gong Mongolia are doing when the prime minister is always based on generous treat people, Taizong very appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 吕文穆公蒙正做宰相时总以宽厚待人，太宗非常赏识。

sentences.english: He was very easy with me on that debt.
sentences.chinese: 在这笔债务上他对我很宽厚。

sentences.english: The technical features of 100t converter and wide and heavy continuous casting slab system were introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍柳钢100吨转炉及宽厚板坯连铸系统技术特点。

sentences.english: A disposition to show mercy, especially toward an offender or enemy.
sentences.chinese: 仁慈，宽厚天性慈悲的，尤指对罪犯或敌人。

sentences.english: His broad, pale back was soaked with blood-red slashes .
sentences.chinese: 他那宽厚而又苍白的后背上布满血红的伤痕。

sentences.english: His thick arms crossed on his hogshead of a chest.
sentences.chinese: 他的粗手交叉抱在宽厚的胸前。

sentences.english: He who in adversity would have succor, let him be generous while he rests secure.
sentences.chinese: 谁想在逆境中得到援助，就应在身处顺境时待人宽厚。

sentences.english: Among mountains of tribulation, nature, embraced Rousseau with her lenient heart.
sentences.chinese: 在重重磨难中，自然，以她宽厚的胸怀拥抱了卢梭。

sentences.english: Even that may be too kind a comparison.
sentences.chinese: 这样一种比较也许是过于宽厚了。
